REVISION.name: REVISION
REVISION.description: Revision number of the controller core.

PHYW.name: PHYW
PHYW.description: Data width of the transciever connected to the controller core. PHYW bit reset value is

enumeratedValues.name: PHYW_0
enumeratedValues.description: 8 bit wide data bus Software non-programmable

enumeratedValues.name: PHYW_1
enumeratedValues.description: 16 bit wide data bus Software non-programmable

enumeratedValues.name: PHYW_2
enumeratedValues.description: Reset to 8 bit wide data bus Software programmable

enumeratedValues.name: PHYW_3
enumeratedValues.description: Reset to 16 bit wide data bus Software programmable

enumeratedValues.name: PHYM_5
enumeratedValues.description: Software programmable - reset to ULPI DDR

enumeratedValues.name: SM_0
enumeratedValues.description: No Serial Engine, always use parallel signalling.

enumeratedValues.name: SM_1
enumeratedValues.description: Serial Engine present, always use serial signalling for FS/LS.

enumeratedValues.name: SM_2
enumeratedValues.description: Software programmable - Reset to use parallel signalling for FS/LS

enumeratedValues.name: SM_3
enumeratedValues.description: Software programmable - Reset to use serial signalling for FS/LS

HC.name: HC
HC.description: Host Capable. Indicating whether host operation mode is supported or not.

NPORT.name: NPORT
NPORT.description: The Nmber of downstream ports supported by the host controller is (NPORT+1)

DC.name: DC
DC.description: Device Capable. Indicating whether device operation mode is supported or not.

TXBURST.name: TXBURST
TXBURST.description: Default burst size for memory to TX buffer transfer

TXCHANADD.name: TXCHANADD
TXCHANADD.description: TX FIFO Buffer size is: (2^TXCHANADD) * 4 Bytes

RXBURST.name: RXBURST
RXBURST.description: Default burst size for memory to RX buffer transfer

RXADD.name: RXADD
RXADD.description: Buffer total size for all receive endpoints is (2^RXADD)

GPTLD.name: GPTLD
GPTLD.description: General Purpose Timer Load Value These bit fields are loaded to GPTCNT bits when GPTRST bit is set '1b'

GPTCNT.name: GPTCNT
GPTCNT.description: General Purpose Timer Counter. This field is the count value of the countdown timer.

GPTMODE.name: GPTMODE
GPTMODE.description: General Purpose Timer Mode In one shot mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt, and stop until the counter is reset by software; In repeat mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt and automatically reload the counter value from GPTLD bits to start again

enumeratedValues.name: GPTRST_1
enumeratedValues.description: Load counter value from GPTLD bits in n_GPTIMER0LD

GPTRUN.name: GPTRUN
GPTRUN.description: General Purpose Timer Run GPTCNT bits are not effected when setting or clearing this bit.

GPTLD.name: GPTLD
GPTLD.description: General Purpose Timer Load Value These bit fields are loaded to GPTCNT bits when GPTRST bit is set '1b'

GPTCNT.name: GPTCNT
GPTCNT.description: General Purpose Timer Counter. This field is the count value of the countdown timer.

GPTMODE.name: GPTMODE
GPTMODE.description: General Purpose Timer Mode In one shot mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt, and stop until the counter is reset by software

enumeratedValues.name: GPTRST_1
enumeratedValues.description: Load counter value from GPTLD bits in USB_n_GPTIMER0LD

GPTRUN.name: GPTRUN
GPTRUN.description: General Purpose Timer Run GPTCNT bits are not effected when setting or clearing this bit.

AHBBRST.name: AHBBRST
AHBBRST.description: AHB master interface Burst configuration These bits control AHB master transfer type sequence (or priority)

enumeratedValues.name: AHBBRST_0
enumeratedValues.description: Incremental burst of unspecified length only

enumeratedValues.name: AHBBRST_2
enumeratedValues.description: INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then single transfer

enumeratedValues.name: AHBBRST_3
enumeratedValues.description: INCR16 burst, INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then single transfer

enumeratedValues.name: AHBBRST_5
enumeratedValues.description: INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

enumeratedValues.name: AHBBRST_6
enumeratedValues.description: INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

enumeratedValues.name: AHBBRST_7
enumeratedValues.description: INCR16 burst, INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

CAPLENGTH.name: CAPLENGTH
CAPLENGTH.description: These bits are used as an offset to add to register base to find the beginning of the Operational Register

HCIVERSION.name: HCIVERSION
HCIVERSION.description: Host Controller Interface Version Number Default value is '10h', which means EHCI rev1.0.

PPC.name: PPC
PPC.description: Port Power Control This field indicates whether the host controller implementation includes port power control

N_PCC.name: N_PCC
N_PCC.description: Number of Ports per Companion Controller This field indicates the number of ports supported per internal Companion Controller

enumeratedValues.name: N_CC_0
enumeratedValues.description: There is no internal Companion Controller and port-ownership hand-off is not supported.

enumeratedValues.name: N_CC_1
enumeratedValues.description: There are internal companion controller(s) and port-ownership hand-offs is supported.

PI.name: PI
PI.description: Port Indicators (P INDICATOR) This bit indicates whether the ports support port indicator control

N_PTT.name: N_PTT
N_PTT.description: Number of Ports per Transaction Translator (N_PTT)

ADC.name: ADC
ADC.description: 64-bit Addressing Capability This bit is set '0b' in all controller core, no 64-bit addressing capability is supported

PFL.name: PFL
PFL.description: Programmable Frame List Flag If this bit is set to zero, then the system software must use a frame list length of 1024 elements with this host controller

ASP.name: ASP
ASP.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Capability If this bit is set to a one, then the host controller supports the park feature for high-speed queue heads in the Asynchronous Schedule

DCIVERSION.name: DCIVERSION
DCIVERSION.description: Device Controller Interface Version Number Default value is '01h', which means rev0.1.

DEN.name: DEN
DEN.description: Device Endpoint Number This field indicates the number of endpoints built into the device controller

DC.name: DC
DC.description: Device Capable When this bit is 1, this controller is capable of operating as a USB 2.0 device.

HC.name: HC
HC.description: Host Capable When this bit is 1, this controller is capable of operating as an EHCI compatible USB 2

enumeratedValues.name: PSE_0
enumeratedValues.description: Do not process the Periodic Schedule

enumeratedValues.name: PSE_1
enumeratedValues.description: Use the PERIODICLISTBASE register to access the Periodic Schedule.

enumeratedValues.name: ASE_0
enumeratedValues.description: Do not process the Asynchronous Schedule.

enumeratedValues.name: ASE_1
enumeratedValues.description: Use the ASYNCLISTADDR register to access the Asynchronous Schedule.

IAA.name: IAA
IAA.description: Interrupt on Async Advance Doorbell - Read/Write

ASP.name: ASP
ASP.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Mode Count - Read/Write

ASPE.name: ASPE
ASPE.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Mode Enable - Read/Write

FS_2.name: FS_2
FS_2.description: Frame List Size - (Read/Write or Read Only)

UE.name: UE
UE.description: USB Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

UEE.name: UEE
UEE.description: USB Error Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UEI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

PCE.name: PCE
PCE.description: Port Change Detect Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the PCI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

FRE.name: FRE
FRE.description: Frame List Rollover Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the FRI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

SEE.name: SEE
SEE.description: System Error Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SEI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

AAE.name: AAE
AAE.description: Async Advance Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the AAI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

URE.name: URE
URE.description: USB Reset Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the URI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

SRE.name: SRE
SRE.description: SOF Received Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SRI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

SLE.name: SLE
SLE.description: Sleep Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SLI bit in n_n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

ULPIE.name: ULPIE
ULPIE.description: ULPI Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UPLII bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

NAKE.name: NAKE
NAKE.description: NAK Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the NAKI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

UAIE.name: UAIE
UAIE.description: USB Host Asynchronous Interrupt Enable When this bit is one, and the UAI bit in the n_USBSTS register is one, host controller will issue an interrupt at the next interrupt threshold

UPIE.name: UPIE
UPIE.description: USB Host Periodic Interrupt Enable When this bit is one, and the UPI bit in the n_USBSTS register is one, host controller will issue an interrupt at the next interrupt threshold

TIE0.name: TIE0
TIE0.description: General Purpose Timer #0 Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the TI0 bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

TIE1.name: TIE1
TIE1.description: General Purpose Timer #1 Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the TI1 bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

USBADR.name: USBADR
USBADR.description: Device Address. These bits correspond to the USB device address

CF.name: CF
CF.description: Configure Flag Host software sets this bit as the last action in its process of configuring the Host Controller

enumeratedValues.name: CF_0
enumeratedValues.description: Port routing control logic default-routes each port to an implementation dependent classic host controller.

enumeratedValues.name: CF_1
enumeratedValues.description: Port routing control logic default-routes all ports to this host controller.

enumeratedValues.name: OCA_0
enumeratedValues.description: This port does not have an over-current condition.

enumeratedValues.name: OCA_1
enumeratedValues.description: This port currently has an over-current condition

PR.name: PR
PR.description: Port Reset - Read/Write or Read Only

PHCD.name: PHCD
PHCD.description: PHY Low Power Suspend - Clock Disable (PLPSCD) - Read/Write

PFSC.name: PFSC
PFSC.description: Port Force Full Speed Connect - Read/Write

PSPD.name: PSPD
PSPD.description: Port Speed - Read Only. This register field indicates the speed at which the port is operating.

PTW.name: PTW
PTW.description: Parallel Transceiver Width This bit has no effect if serial interface engine is used

STS.name: STS
STS.description: Serial Transceiver Select 1 Serial Interface Engine is selected 0 Parallel Interface signals is selected Serial Interface Engine can be used in combination with UTMI+/ULPI physical interface to provide FS/LS signaling instead of the parallel interface signals

PTS_1.name: PTS_1
PTS_1.description: All USB port interface modes are listed in this field description, but not all are supported

VD.name: VD
VD.description: VBUS_Discharge - Read/Write. Setting this bit causes VBus to discharge through a resistor.

IDPU.name: IDPU
IDPU.description: ID Pullup - Read/Write This bit provide control over the ID pull-up resistor; 0 = off, 1 = on [default]

ID.name: ID
ID.description: USB ID - Read Only. 0 = A device, 1 = B device

AVV.name: AVV
AVV.description: A VBus Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the A VBus valid threshold.

ASV.name: ASV
ASV.description: A Session Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the A session valid threshold.

BSV.name: BSV
BSV.description: B Session Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the B session valid threshold.

BSE.name: BSE
BSE.description: B Session End - Read Only. Indicates VBus is below the B session end threshold.

TOG_1MS.name: TOG_1MS
TOG_1MS.description: 1 millisecond timer toggle - Read Only. This bit toggles once per millisecond.

DPS.name: DPS
DPS.description: Data Bus Pulsing Status - Read Only

AVVIS.name: AVVIS
AVVIS.description: A VBus Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

ASVIS.name: ASVIS
ASVIS.description: A Session Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BSVIS.name: BSVIS
BSVIS.description: B Session Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BSEIS.name: BSEIS
BSEIS.description: B Session End Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

STATUS_1MS.name: STATUS_1MS
STATUS_1MS.description: 1 millisecond timer Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

DPIS.name: DPIS
DPIS.description: Data Pulse Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

IDIE.name: IDIE
IDIE.description: USB ID Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the USB ID interrupt.

AVVIE.name: AVVIE
AVVIE.description: A VBus Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the A VBus valid interrupt.

ASVIE.name: ASVIE
ASVIE.description: A Session Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write

BSVIE.name: BSVIE
BSVIE.description: B Session Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write

BSEIE.name: BSEIE
BSEIE.description: B Session End Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the B session end interrupt.

enumeratedValues.name: CM_2
enumeratedValues.description: Device Controller [Default for device only controller]

enumeratedValues.name: CM_3
enumeratedValues.description: Host Controller [Default for host only controller]

enumeratedValues.name: SLOM_1
enumeratedValues.description: Setup Lockouts Off (DCD requires use of Setup Data Buffer Tripwire in USBCMDUSB Command Register .

ERBR.name: ERBR
ERBR.description: Endpoint Receive Buffer Ready -- Read Only

ETBR.name: ETBR
ETBR.description: Endpoint Transmit Buffer Ready -- Read Only

RXS.name: RXS
RXS.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

RXT.name: RXT
RXT.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control Endpoint0 is fixed as a Control End Point.

RXE.name: RXE
RXE.description: RX Endpoint Enable 1 Enabled Endpoint0 is always enabled.

TXS.name: TXS
TXS.description: TX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK [Default] 1 End Point Stalled Software can write a one to this bit to force the endpoint to return a STALL handshake to the Host

TXT.name: TXT
TXT.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 - Control Endpoint0 is fixed as a Control End Point.

TXE.name: TXE
TXE.description: TX Endpoint Enable 1 Enabled Endpoint0 is always enabled.

RXS.name: RXS
RXS.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

RXD.name: RXD
RXD.description: RX Endpoint Data Sink - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [Default] Should always be written as zero

RXT.name: RXT
RXT.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

RXI.name: RXI
RXI.description: RX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled This bit is only used for test and should always be written as zero

RXR.name: RXR
RXR.description: RX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the host and device

RXE.name: RXE
RXE.description: RX Endpoint Enable 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled An Endpoint should be enabled only after it has been configured

TXS.name: TXS
TXS.description: TX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK 1 End Point Stalled This bit will be cleared automatically upon receipt of a SETUP request if this Endpoint is configured as a Control Endpoint and this bit will continue to be cleared by hardware until the associated ENDPTSETUPSTAT bit is cleared

TXD.name: TXD
TXD.description: TX Endpoint Data Source - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [DEFAULT] Should always be written as 0

TXT.name: TXT
TXT.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

TXI.name: TXI
TXI.description: TX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 PID Sequencing Enabled

TXR.name: TXR
TXR.description: TX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the Host and device

TXE.name: TXE
TXE.description: TX Endpoint Enable 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled An Endpoint should be enabled only after it has been configured

RXS.name: RXS
RXS.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

RXD.name: RXD
RXD.description: RX Endpoint Data Sink - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [Default] Should always be written as zero

RXT.name: RXT
RXT.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

RXI.name: RXI
RXI.description: RX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled This bit is only used for test and should always be written as zero

RXR.name: RXR
RXR.description: RX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the host and device

TXD.name: TXD
TXD.description: TX Endpoint Data Source - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [DEFAULT] Should always be written as 0

TXT.name: TXT
TXT.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

TXI.name: TXI
TXI.description: TX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 PID Sequencing Enabled

TXR.name: TXR
TXR.description: TX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the Host and device
